title: Thorsten Seehaus
text:
Thorsten Seehaus
Dr. Thorsten Seehaus
Curriculum Vitae
[Remotesensing and GIS](https://geographie.cms.rrze.uni-erlangen.de/forschung/ag-braun/)
2012-2016: PhD Student at the Department of Geography, FAU Erlangen-Nürnberg, Germany, Group:
[Remotesensing and GIS](https://geographie.cms.rrze.uni-erlangen.de/forschung/ag-braun/)
2005-2011: Diploma in Physics, Julius Maximilians University Würzburg, Germany
2004-2005: Intermediate diploma in Physical Engineering, University of Applied Sciences Coburg, Germany

Research
Projects:
Running:
[M3OCCA](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_2): International Doctoral Programme: Measuring and Modelling Mountian Glaciers in a Changing Climate, ENB [CSAPIS](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_3): Climate sensitivity of western Antarctic Peninsula ice shelves, DFG [ LASSI](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_5): Large-scale Automatic Calving Front Segmentation and Frontal Ablation Analysis of Arctic Glaciers using Synthetic-Aperture Radar Image Sequences, DFG [UNLOC](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_4): Unlocking the glaciological information of historical aerial imagery to obtain long-term glacier mass balance information and to identify drivers of glacier changes on the Antarctic Peninsula, DFG [MIT-AP](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_9): Mass balance and ice dynamics of Antarctic Peninsula glaciers, ESA [INSULATE & APGCP](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_6): Polar-5 geodetic & geophysical airborne surveys on the Antarctic Peninsula, AWI/HGF
Completed:
[VELMAP](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_19): Velocities, elevation and mass changes of Antarctic Peninsula Glaciers, DFG [HGF](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_21) Alliance “Remote Sensing and Earth System Dynamics” (EDA) [GEKKO](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_28): Assessment of essential climate variables – Observation of glacier changes in the tropical Andes, BMWi/DLR [IMPECCAPLE](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_29): IMProved gEodetiC glaCier mAss BaLancE measurements by integrating remote sensing, surface mass balance and firn compaction modelling – a case study from James Ross Island, Antarctica, DFG [RETREAT](https://www.geographie.nat.fau.de/forschung/ag-braun/?preview=true#collapse_31): Operational glacier velocities processing from Sentinel-1 data, BMBF/DLR [PPF-TA](https://www.geographie.nat.fau.de/forschung/ag-braun/?preview=true#collapse_32): Assessment of glacier changes in the Tropical Andes, FAU Emerging Talents Initative [TAPE](https://www.geography.nat.fau.eu/research/ag-braun/#collapse_30): Tapping the potential of Earth Observations, FAU Emerging Fields Initiative
